thread.title: Rampage drop season opener in OT
thread.title_full: Rampage drop season opener in OT - San Antonio Express-News

author: Staff report
title: Rampage drop season opener in OT
text:
CEDAR PARK — The Rampage, in their first game as an affiliate of the Colorado Avalanche , fell 5-4 in overtime to the Texas Stars in the season opener Saturday in Cedar Park.
Ben Street led the Rampage, who led 2-0 after the first period, with a goal and two assists. Andrew Agozzino, Maxim Noreau and Dennis Everberg each finished with a goal and an assist.
Texas struck 25 seconds into the second period on Radek Faska’s first of two goals. The Rampage went back ahead by two thanks to Everberg on the power play at 17:54.
The Stars scored three unanswered goals in the third for a 4-3 lead. Street potted the equalizer with 1:08 left to force OT, where the Stars’ Devin Shore scored less than two minutes in.
The Rampage outshot Texas 37-28. Goaltender Calvin Pickard finished with 23 saves.
Next: Rampage at Grand Rapids, 6 p.m. Friday
Radio: KTKR-AM 760
